David Lean\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\&#039;s \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Doctor Zhivago\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" is a classic film, one that will live on as 
long as their are films. There are scenes in this movie that will invariably
become indelibly etched in the viewers imagination: The opening funeral 
march through the vast Siberian landscape, the grandeur of the Czarist 
Russian palaces, the march of the revolutionaries through the Moscow 
boulevards, the train ride
straight out of Dante\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\&#039;s Inferno, the Ice-covered interior of the Zhivago 
country estate (a truly magical moment in the film), the wealth of 
beauty captured in the cinematography of this film is astonishing. 
Julie Christie\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\&#039;s Lara is one of those great screen personas--she 
becomes a woman of such mysterious beauty. The
final scene of Yuri\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\&#039;s desperate attempt to reach her in the crowded 
Soviet Moscow is heartbreaking. And that music score! The opening film 
credits with Jarre\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\&#039;s genuinely beautiful music, complete with balalaikas 
sets the mood for this great, grand entertainment. One of the best ever!
